creator: dimaki@gmx.de
text:
If I use the example .fo files coming with FOP 1.0dev, page breaks are ignored.
Also if I tried a simple example of my own with 'break-before="page"' in an
fo:block it does not work.
This is happening with PDF output and with RTF (I know this is very very alpha ;-))

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
You should know that not only the RTF output is "very very alpha", the PDF 
output of FOP 1.0dev is, too. Don't worry, breaks are on the todo list. But of 
course, you might want to implement them yourself and send a patch. :-) Breaks 
shouldn't be too hard to implement and we're always happy if someone helps in 
the development.

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
break-before="page" works in FOP 0.93 for all output formats except RTF (See
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=42600)
batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
